definitions.definition: The spirit; the soul of man.
The disembodied soul; the soul or spirit of a deceased person; a spirit appearing after death
definitions.example: Everyone believed that the ghost of an old lady haunted the crypt.

definitions.definition: Any faint shadowy semblance; an unsubstantial image
definitions.example: not a ghost of a chance; the ghost of an idea

definitions.definition: A false image formed in a telescope, camera, or other optical device by reflection from the surfaces of one or more lenses.
An unwanted image similar to and overlapping or adjacent to the main one on a television screen, caused by the transmitted image being received both directly and via reflection.
A ghostwriter.
An unresponsive user on IRC, resulting from the user's client disconnecting without notifying the server.
An image of a file or hard disk.
An understudy.
A covert (and deniable) agent.
The faint image that remains after an attempt to remove graffiti.
An opponent in a racing game that follows a previously recorded route, allowing players to compete against previous best times.
A dead person whose identity is stolen by another. See ghosting.
(in names of species) White or pale.
definitions.example: ghost slug; ghostberry; ghostflower; ghost crab; ghost bat

definitions.definition: (in names of species) Transparent or translucent.
definitions.example: ghost ant; ghost catfish; ghost nipper; ghost nudibranch

definitions.definition: Abandoned.
definitions.example: ghost town; ghost net; ghost ramp; ghost ship

definitions.definition: Remnant; the remains of a(n).
definitions.example: ghost cell; ghost crater; ghost image

definitions.definition: Perceived or listed but not real.
definitions.example: ghost pain; ghost cellphone vibration; ghost island; ghost voter

definitions.definition: Of cryptid, supernatural or extraterrestrial nature.
definitions.example: ghost rocket; ghost deer; ghost cat

definitions.definition: Substitute.
definitions.example: ghost writer; ghost band; ghost singer

definitions.definition: To haunt; to appear to in the form of an apparition.
To die; to expire.
To ghostwrite.
To sail seemingly without wind.
To copy a file or hard drive image.
To gray out (a visual item) to indicate that it is unavailable.
To forcibly disconnect an IRC user who is using one's reserved nickname.
To appear without warning; to move quickly and quietly; to slip.
To kill.
To break up with someone without warning or explanation; to perform an act of ghosting.
